business.headline: Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold. The message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

More jobs, higher incomes: New Zealand PM Luxon hails India free trade agreementIndia and New Zealand have successfully concluded a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement, marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.

Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

entertainment.headline: Drishyam 3 producer sends legal notice to Akshaye Khanna: Success went to his head Producer Kumar Mangat Pathak confirmed Jaideep Ahlawat has taken over Akshaye Khanna's role in Drishyam 3. He accused the Dhurandhar actor of unprofessional conduct and confirmed sending him a legal notice.

Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 2: Kartik's film slows down amid Dhurandhar storm Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri has struggled to make an impact at the box office despite a Christmas release, with collections remaining modest over its first two days.

Dhurandhar box office day 22: Ranveer Singh's film set to beat Pathaan globally Aditya Dhar's action thriller Dhurandhar, after surpassing the Rs 1000 crore milestone, is on track to overtake the lifetime collections of Pathaan and Kalki 2898. The film stars Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal and others.

Cashero review: Lee Jun-ho shines, but the K-drama struggles to cash in on its ideaRelease Date:Fri Dec 26, 2025 Cashero presents a quirky Netflix superhero drama where strength is powered by cash, cleverly tapping into modern financial anxiety and social commentary. Anchored by Lee Jun-ho's sincere performance, the series remains engaging but is held back by uneven writing and inconsistent pacing.

Salman Khan at 60: Inside the star-studded birthday bash. See pics, videos Images and videos from Salman Khan's milestone birthday party at his Panvel farmhouse have surfaced on social media. The celebrations were attended by the actor's family, close friends, and industry colleagues.

Bollywood's 2025: Dhurandhar, Chhaava, Saiyaara and some box office reality checks In 2025, Bollywood saw audiences grow choosy – stories and emotion mattered more than star power. Hits like Dhurandhar and Chhaava restored faith, while many big-budget films fizzled after opening weekends.

Salman Khan at 60: From Dus Ka Dum to Bigg Boss, how TV turned him into India's darling As Salman Khan celebrates his 60th birthday, here's a reflection on his impactful TV career. His presence on shows like Bigg Boss has created a unique bond with fans and contestants alike.

Superhero to 60-year-old protagonist: How South cinema let women breathe in 2025 South cinema in 2025 quietly embraced diverse women-led narratives across industries. This shift challenges stereotypes and highlights authentic female experiences without compromise.

Anasuya Bharadwaj calls out age-shaming after Sivaji comments spark backlash Actor Anasuya Bharadwaj responded to age-shaming trolls after her online criticism of actor Sivaji's sexist remarks during a recent promotional event.

Drishyam 3 update: Jaideep Ahlawat joins Ajay Devgn and Tabu The much-anticipated third instalment of the Drishyam franchise will feature Jaideep Ahlawat joining Ajay Devgn and Tabu, with filming set to start in January 2026. The movie continues the story of Vijay Salgaonkar, played by Devgn, and introduces new twists to the established storyline.

After Dhurandhar impacts its run, Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 eyes January re-release The comedy sequel Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2, starring Kapil Sharma, is set for a re-release in January 2026 after its initial run was affected by competition from Dhurandhar. The producers hope to bring the film back to wider audiences following limited screen availability during its original release.

Saba Azad welcomes bride with a sweet note after Hrithik Roshan's cousin wedding Saba Azad welcomed Aishwarya Singh into the Roshan family with a heartfelt note as Hrithik Roshan attended cousin Eshaan Roshan's wedding celebrations in Mumbai.

Chella Magale out: Vijay sings soulful father-daughter song in Jana Nayagan Jana Nayagan's third single, Chella Magale, sung by Thalapathy Vijay, beautifully captures the emotional bond between a father and daughter. The heartfelt melody has stirred excitement among fans ahead of the grand Pongal release.

Amaal Mallik clears air on mystery girl: Never been lucky in love Amaal Mallik has revealed that the mystery girl he spoke about on Bigg Boss 19 is no longer in his life, confirming that he is currently single.

Actor Shubhangi Atre denies pay row, explains Bhabhiji Ghar Par Hain exit Shubhangi Atre has opened up about her reasons for departing from the long-running series Bhabhiji Ghar Par Hain. In an interview, she addressed rumours and reflected on personal challenges during her tenure.

Tanya Mittal gives tour of her condom factory, recalls being trolled by Salman Khan After facing criticism on Bigg Boss 18, Tanya Mittal gives a behind-the-scenes look at her Gwalior condom factory, addressing rumours about her business ventures. She also spoke about being trolled by the show's host, Salman Khan.

Salman Khan to share major Battle Of Galwan update on his birthday: Report Salman Khan is set to celebrate his birthday on December 27 by sharing a major update from his upcoming film Battle of Galwan. The reveal, expected to include a key asset from the film, is planned as a special treat for his fans.

Vijay greeted by roaring crowds in Malaysia ahead of Jana Nayagan audio launch Thalapathy Vijay landed in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, ahead of the grand audio launch of his much-anticipated film Jana Nayagan, widely believed to be his final outing on the big screen. Videos circulating on X show the actor receiving a thunderous welcome, with fans erupting in cheers as he arrived at his hotel.

Amitabh Bachchan shares his Christmas memory of Calcutta's midnight mass Actor Amitabh Bachchan posted a heartfelt Christmas message, recalling his early experiences attending midnight mass in Calcutta and expressing wishes for peace and happiness to his followers.

general news.headline: Massive pre-New Year crackdown in Delhi: 285 arrested, weapons and drugs seizedDelhi Police launched a massive overnight crackdown under Operation Aaghat, arresting 285 people and seizing weapons, drugs, and cash to curb organised crime ahead of New Year celebrations.

Gandhis, Shashi Tharoor attend Congress top body meet. What's on agenda?The Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting, the first after the Bihar election debacle, will focus on mobilising public support against the 'anti-people' G RAM G law, which replaced the UPA-era MGNREGA.

Bricks, chaos, fear: Islamist mob wrecks rock concert in Bangladesh, 20 injuredA historic school anniversary in Faridpur, Bangladesh, ended in chaos as an Islamist mob attacked a concert by rock legend James, injuring at least 20 people. The event was abruptly cancelled.

5,000 doctors, 11,000 engineers exit. Pak mocks Asim Munir's 'brain gain' claimPakistan has lost 5,000 doctors and 11,000 engineers over the past 24 months, as per a government report. It has prompted Pakistanis to ridicule army chief Asim Munir, who recently tried to put a positive spin on the mass migration and called it 'brain gain'.

Hidden deep underwater lies India's second-strike nuclear guaranteeIndia reportedly tested a nuclear-capable submarine-launched ballistic missile this week. The test launch, not officially acknowledged, marks steady progress in India's quest to ensure a second-strike capability and strengthen its nuclear posture. Here's how.

The Caldwell Conundrum: Anatomy of an academic artefactBishop Robert Caldwell remains an inescapable and towering figure. His 1875 Comparative Grammar successfully executed an epistemological upheaval, providing the intellectual framework for the cultural, linguistic and political assertion of the South, particularly Tamil Nadu where he was most active, as separate from the 'rest'.

Drishyam 3 producer sends legal notice to Akshaye Khanna: Success went to his headProducer Kumar Mangat Pathak confirmed Jaideep Ahlawat has taken over Akshaye Khanna's role in Drishyam 3. He accused the Dhurandhar actor of unprofessional conduct and confirmed sending him a legal notice.

Tarique Rahman brings a new player into Bangladesh politics: Daughter ZaimaBack in Bangladesh after 17 years in exile, BNP's de-facto chief Tarique Rahman has introduced another element in Dhaka's politics, his daughter Zaima. A London-trained barrister who talks of Khaleda as "dadu", Zaima is taking her first cautious steps into Bangladesh's political maze.

Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold. The message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

Salman Khan at 60: From Dus Ka Dum to Bigg Boss, how TV turned him into India's darlingAs Salman Khan celebrates his 60th birthday, here's a reflection on his impactful TV career. His presence on shows like Bigg Boss has created a unique bond with fans and contestants alike.

Meet Diya Binu, Kerala's 1st Gen Z and India's youngest municipal chairpersonDiya Binu Pullikkakandam, who is being labelled as Kerala's first Gen Z municipal chairperson, won the election from Pala municipality's 15th ward as an independent candidate.

Rift in Bangladesh students party as desperate factions dial Jamaat, BNPWith a little over a month to go for Bangladesh's promised elections, the Muhammad Yunus-favoured NCP has initiated seat-sharing talks with the Jamaat-e-Islami. At the same time, the anti-Jamaat faction within the NCP is exploring an alliance with the BNP. Is it on the verge of a split?

Queues, cages and chaos: Cricketing superpower India must treat its fans betterWatching live sport should be a once-in-a-lifetime thrill. But in India, it too often becomes a test of patience, despite the BCCI being among the richest sporting bodies in the world. Fans who spend big bucks to watch their cricketing stars live deserve a far better deal from the administrators.

Class 10 student dies by suicide in UP after AI cheating allegation at schoolA 16-year-old student in Greater Noida West allegedly died by suicide after being questioned over suspected AI use during exams. The incident has sparked allegations of mental harassment against school authorities.

I froze, then fought back: Bengaluru woman speaks out on groping on metro trainA 45-year-old man allegedly groped a young woman during a metro ride on December 23, prompting her to confront him inside the coach and at the station.

Janaki Ammal, India's first woman PhD, and the reason sugarcanes are sweet todayJanaki Ammal, a botanist and India's first woman with a PhD, developed the sweet sugarcane we know in India today, challenged caste and gender bias, defended forests, never married, and lived a life of fierce independence, leaving a legacy that still shapes Indian science.
Tiny falcons reach Zimbabwe after flying 5,000 km in 5 days from IndiaThree satellite-tagged Amur falcons have completed a record-breaking journey from India to Southern Africa.

Bollywood's 2025: Dhurandhar, Chhaava, Saiyaara and some box office reality checksIn 2025, Bollywood saw audiences grow choosy – stories and emotion mattered more than star power. Hits like Dhurandhar and Chhaava restored faith, while many big-budget films fizzled after opening weekends.

Delhi woman says Bengaluru should be India's national capital. Internet reactsA woman from Delhi has sparked a heated conversation online after sharing her experiences comparing Bengaluru and Delhi, highlighting issues of air quality, safety, and infrastructure.

Are bananas good for weight loss or weight gain? Nutritionist breaks it downBananas are often labelled as fattening, yet recommended by fitness experts. Are they a friend or foe when it comes to body weight? A nutritionist breaks down the calories, carbs and smart ways to eat them.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Ashes: England end 5,468-day drought in Australia with 4-wicket win at MCGEngland have ended a 5,468-day wait to win a Test match in Australia as they won the fourth Ashes Test by four wickets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Josh Tongue was adjudged Player of the Match for taking 7/89 in the match.

Why Asim Munir should fear DhurandharDhurandhar attacks the third pillar of Pakistan's centre of gravity strategy — targeting India's civilian mind space. So far, the Indian movie industry has failed to see the Pakistan deep state's duplicity.

sports.headline: Australia face T20 World Cup scare after Tim David suffers injury in Big Bash Australia's T20 World Cup build-up has hit a speed bump with Tim David injured. The powerful batter's hamstring concern now puts his availability in doubt just weeks before the tournament in India and Sri Lanka.

Ashes: England end 5,468-day drought in Australia with 4-wicket win at MCG England have ended a 5,468-day wait to win a Test match in Australia as they won the fourth Ashes Test by four wickets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Josh Tongue was adjudged Player of the Match for taking 7/89 in the match.

Queues, cages and chaos: Cricketing superpower India must treat its fans better Watching live sport should be a once-in-a-lifetime thrill. But in India, it too often becomes a test of patience, despite the BCCI being among the richest sporting bodies in the world. Fans who spend big bucks to watch their cricketing stars live deserve a far better deal from the administrators.

Kohli signs match ball for Vishal Jayswal, the Gujarat spinner who dismissed him Gujarat bowler Vishal Jayswal had the day of his life after dismissing Virat Kohli in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26. He picked up 4 wickets to restrict Delhi to 254/9 and got the match ball signed by the star batter after the match.

Watch: Kylian Mbappe turns fan, dons Achraf Hakimi jersey during Morocco's AFCON clash Kylian Mbappe attended Morocco's AFCON group match against Mali from the stands in Rabat. The Real Madrid forward wore Achraf Hakimi's jersey, backing his close friend during the tournament.

MS Dhoni celebrates Salman Khan's 60th birthday at actor's farmhouse MS Dhoni was seen at Salman Khan's 60th birthday bash held at his Panvel farmhouse. He attended the event alongside wife Sakshi Dhoni and daughter Ziva Dhoni.

Robert Lewandowski hints at future away from FC Barcelona: Don't know where I'll play Robert Lewandowski's future at Barcelona hangs in the balance as contract talks stall. With Saudi and MLS interest growing, the veteran striker has time, options, and no pressure as a pivotal decision looms.

England's injury woes continue as Gus Atkinson pulls hamstring in Melbourne Gus Atkinson suffered a hamstring injury during Day 2 of the fourth Ashes Test. His injury adds him to the list of English bowlers who've suffered concerns during the ongoing series.

Asia Cup glory for Men, crisis for Women: Indian Hockey's turbulent 2025 2025 ended up being a turbulent year for Indian hockey with the men's team ending their wait for an Asia Cup title, while the women's side faced major issues both on and off the field. The Hockey India League also saw chaos with teams pulling out, while the Jr. men's team showed promise under PR Sreejesh.

Ashes 2025 sees new controversy as Labuschagne fumes at MCG dismissal Ashes 2025 found fresh controversy at the MCG as Marnus Labuschagne's dismissal split opinion. A disputed low catch, angry reaction and renewed DRS debate ensured drama once again overshadowed cricket.

Manchester United's back four get Rubem Amorim's backing after Newcastle win Ruben Amorim finally bent without breaking as Manchester United edged Newcastle. A rare tactical tweak, gritty defending and Patrick Dorgu's moment of quality delivered a timely clean sheet and renewed belief at Old Trafford.

India return close? Shreyas returns to nets, arrives at BCCI CoE before NZ ODIsShreyas Iyer has stepped up his return to cricket as the India ODI vice-captain started training in the nets and arrived at the BCCI Centre Of Excellence in Bengaluru ahead of the New Zealand series.

World Rapid C'ships: Krishna, Carlsen share early lead, Gukesh makes slow startFifteen-year-old Goutham Krishna emerged as a surprise joint leader after winning all three games on Day 1, while Indian stars experienced a mixed start in the World Rapid Championships. Krishna leads the way alongside World No.1 Magnus Carlsen.

Unsold in IPL auction, Devon Conway hits 26-ball fifty in SA20 openerUnsold at the IPL 2026 auction, Devon Conway sent a strong reminder of his class with a blazing 26-ball fifty to headline Durban's Super Giants' 232 for 5 against MI Cape Town in the SA20 2025 opener.

Watch: Bus Driver uses Hilarious Technique to record Virat Kohli, video wins InternetThe bus driver of the Delhi cricket team is winning hearts as he used a hilarious technique to record Virat Kohli during his time with his state side during the Vijay Hazare Trophy campaign. Kohli played two matches for Delhi in the competition.

Job done: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma head home after Vijay Hazare Trophy heroicsIndian men's teams megastars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma lit up the Vijay Hazare Trophy with landmark knocks and fanfare before heading home, now set to return in India's ODI series against New Zealand.

Ashes 2025: Did England set up Bethell for failure at No.3 in Melbourne Test?England's decision to field Jacob Bethell at No.3 in the Melbourne Ashes Test has drawn scrutiny, with the youngster's readiness and recent red-ball experience being questioned by Michael Atherton.

AIFF proposes new structure to save ISL: Own, operate for next 20 seasonsAIFF has proposed a new ownership and governance structure for the ISL, with the governing body looking to own the league for the next 20 seasons. AIFF hopes to start the upcoming season from

Shafali Verma show powers dominant India Women to T20I series win vs Sri LankaIndia Women thrashed Sri Lanka by eight wickets in Trivandrum, sealing a 3-0 series lead, with Shafali Verma's unbeaten 79 and stellar bowling from Renuka Singh and Deepti Sharma driving the comprehensive win.

Process over noise: Pant's post with Kohli goes viral after Delhi's win vs GujaratRishabh Pant posted a set of photos with Virat Kohli and the Delhi team after their thrilling win over Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy on Friday, December 26. Pant and Kohli's knocks helped Delhi secure the win.

T20 World Cup calling? Najmul Shanto slams statement century to light up BPL Day 1BPL 2026: Najmul Hossain Shanto announced his T20 comeback in style, scoring an unbeaten 101 to guide Rajshahi Warriors to an eight-wicket win over Sylhet Titans and stake his claim for Bangladesh's T20 World Cup plans.

Wily Deepti Sharma equals world record after sensational spell in 3rd Women's T20IIND vs SL, 3rd T20I: Indian all-rounder Deepti Sharma became the joint-highest wicket-taker in Women's T20Is after she finished with figures of 4-0-18-3 against Sri Lanka on Friday in Trivandrum.

Fair is fair: Pietersen says Australia must be judged like India over Melbourne pitchKevin Pietersen called for Australia to face the same pitch scrutiny as India after 20 wickets fell on Day 1 of the Melbourne Ashes Test, reigniting debate over bowler-friendly surfaces.

Watch: MCG crowd honours late Shane Warne with hat-tipping tribute on Boxing DayThe late Shane Warne was honoured by the MCG crowd on the opening day of the Boxing Day Test, with fans tipping their hats at 3.50pm local time in tribute to his Australian Test cap number, 350.

IND vs SL Highlights, 3rd WT20I: Shafali's unbeaten fifty drives India to victoryIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women, 3rd T20I Live Score: Shafali Verma puts the stamp on a dominant chase, smashing the winning boundary after a calm single from Harmanpreet Kaur. India cruise home with ease and confidence.

RCB star Devdutt Padikkal continues Bradman-esque run in Vijay Hazare TrophyDevdutt Padikkal's second straight Vijay Hazare century kept Karnataka on course for another win and strengthened his case as one of the tournament's standout batters.

Virat Kohli signs off with Player of the Match awardVirat Kohli reached 1000 runs in the Vijay Hazare Trophy and scored 77 off 61 balls as Delhi beat Gujarat by seven runs on Friday at the Centre of Excellence Ground 1 in Bengaluru.

England greats blame MCG pitch after Ben Stokes's men implode on 20-wicket Day 1AUS vs ENG, 4th Test: England greats Alastair Cook and Stuart Broad slammed the MCG pitch as unfair after 20 wickets fell on a bowler-dominated Day 1 of the Boxing Day Ashes Test.

Magnus Carlsen on facing young rivals like D Gukesh: Don't know how good they may beMagnus Carlsen and D. Gukesh discuss generational shifts and the impact of artificial intelligence in chess ahead of the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championship.

Rs. 7 Cr buy Venkatesh Iyer could miss RCB Playing XI? Kumble's explosive takeAnil Kumble said that Venkatesh Iyer won't be a guaranteed starter for RCB despite them buying the Madhya Pradesh all-rounder for Rs. 7 Crore. Iyer is all set for a new chapter with RCB after moving from KKR.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
